page.title: 06 ROADWATER VILLAGE
page.content: The small village of Roadwater stretches along the valley of the Washford river and has only one road leading up to the Brendon Hills. There are two parts.{Lower Roadwater,}where most of the newer building has been done and the main village, where the shops used to be.There are a number of very old thatched cottages and some unusually high older buildings, but many new houses have been built in recent years. Also people have extended old houses or changed them for other uses. For instance the {Temperance Hall,}built 110 years ago for the miners in the hills,has been converted into a house.The barn at {Vale House,}is being changed into an office.{The Valiant Soldier,}a popular local pub, has a skittle alley, and the butchers shop that used to be next door is now the ladies toilet.
